slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचपरं भूय: प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम् । ‍‍ ॥यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनय: सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गता: ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: I shall again declare the supreme knowledge among all knowledge, by knowing which all the sages have attained the highest perfection.

slokas: इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागता: ।सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: Taking refuge in this knowledge, they attain similarity with me. Even at the time of creation, they are not born, nor do they suffer at the time of dissolution.

slokas: मम योनिर्महद्‍ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् ।सम्भव: सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: My womb is the great Brahman; in that I place the seed. From that, O Bharata, is the birth of all beings.

slokas: सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तय: सम्भवन्ति या: ।तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रद: पिता ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: In all forms that are born, O Kaunteya, the great Brahma is the womb, and I am the seed-giving father.

slokas: सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणा: प्रकृतिसम्भवा: ।निबध्‍नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम् ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: Sattva, rajas, and tamas—these qualities born of nature—bind the imperishable soul to the body, O mighty-armed one.

slokas: तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् ।सुखसङ्गेन बध्‍नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: There, purity being illuminating and free from ailment, binds through attachment to happiness and attachment to knowledge, O sinless one.

slokas: रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भ‍वम् ।तन्निबध्‍नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम् ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: Know that rajas is of the nature of passion, arising from desire and attachment. It binds the embodied being, O Kaunteya, through attachment to action.

slokas: तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम् ।प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्‍नाति भारत ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: Know that the darkness born of ignorance is delusion for all embodied beings. It binds, O Bharata, through negligence, laziness, and sleep.

slokas: सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रज: कर्मणि भारत ।ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तम: प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: Goodness binds one to happiness, passion to action, O Bharata, while darkness, covering knowledge, binds one to negligence.

slokas: रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत ।रज: सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तम: सत्त्वं रजस्तथा ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: Overcoming rajas and tamas, sattva prevails, O Bharata. Rajas overcomes sattva and tamas, and tamas overcomes sattva and rajas as well.

slokas: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते ।ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: When light arises in all the gates of this body, then one should know that knowledge has increased, and that goodness (sattva) is predominant.

slokas: लोभ: प्रवृत्तिरारम्भ: कर्मणामशम: स्पृहा ।रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Greed, activity, the initiation of actions, restlessness, and desire arise when passion (rajas) is predominant, O best of the Bharatas.

slokas: अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च ।तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: Darkness, inactivity, negligence, and delusion arise when ignorance is predominant, O descendant of Kuru.

slokas: यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् ।तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: When the embodied one meets dissolution while sattva is predominant, then he attains the spotless worlds of those who know the highest.

slokas: रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते ।तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: Attaining dissolution in rajas, one is born among those attached to action; similarly, when dissolved in tamas, one is born in the wombs of the deluded.

slokas: कर्मण: सुकृतस्याहु: सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम् ।रजसस्तु फलं दु:खमज्ञानं तमस: फलम् ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: The fruit of a good deed is said to be pure and sattvic; the fruit of rajas is pain, and the fruit of tamas is ignorance.

slokas: सत्त्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च ।प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: From sattva arises knowledge, and from rajas, greed indeed; negligence and delusion arise from tamas, as well as ignorance.

slokas: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसा: ।जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसा: ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: Those situated in the mode of goodness rise upward; those in the mode of passion remain in the middle; and those in the mode of ignorance go downward.

slokas: नान्यं गुणेभ्य: कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति ।गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भ‍ावं सोऽधिगच्छति ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: When the seer perceives no doer other than the qualities and knows what is beyond the qualities, he attains My being.

slokas: गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्देही देहसमुद्भ‍वान् ।जन्ममृत्युजरादु:खैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्न‍ुते ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: Transcending these three qualities that arise from the body, the embodied one is freed from the sufferings of birth, death, and old age, and attains immortality.

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचकैर्लिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो ।किमाचार: कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: By what characteristics is one who has transcended these three modes recognized, O Lord? What is his conduct, and how does he transcend these three modes?

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचप्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव ।न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्‍क्षति ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: The one who neither hates illumination, activity, and delusion when they arise, nor desires them when they cease, O Pandava.

slokas: उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते ।गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येवं योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: Indifferent and unattached, one who is not disturbed by the qualities, who remains steady, knowing that the qualities are active, does not waver.

slokas: समदु:खसुख: स्वस्थ: समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चन: ।तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुति: ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: One who is balanced in joy and sorrow, self-controlled, views a clod of earth, a stone, and gold as the same; who is equal towards the pleasant and the unpleasant, enduring, and equal in praise and blame.

slokas: मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयो: ।सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीत: स उच्यते ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: One who is equal in honor and dishonor, equal towards friend and foe, and who has abandoned all undertakings, is said to be transcendent of the modes of nature.

slokas: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते ।स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: He who worships Me with unwavering devotion through the yoga of devotion, transcends these qualities and becomes eligible for becoming one with Brahman.

slokas: ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च ।शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: I am indeed the foundation of Brahman, of immortality and the imperishable, of eternal dharma, and of absolute bliss.
